members.name: kind
members.comment: Returns the kind of the method handle described by this nominal descriptor.

members.name: refKind
members.comment: Returns the refKind of the method handle described by this nominal reference, as defined by MethodHandleInfo.

members.name: isOwnerInterface
members.comment: Indicates if the method is declared by an interface

return: true if the method is declared by an interface

members.name: owner
members.comment: Returns a ClassDesc describing the class declaring the method or field described by this nominal descriptor.

return: the class declaring the method or field

members.name: methodName
members.comment: Returns the name of the method or field described by this nominal descriptor. For constructors, returns the reserved name "<init>".

return: the name of the method or field

members.name: lookupDescriptor
members.comment: Returns the lookup descriptor of the method handle described by this descriptor, after adjusting for the invocation mode. This will correspond to either a method type descriptor string (for methods and constructors), or a field descriptor string (for field access method handles). The lookup descriptor string is in the same format as accepted by MethodHandleDesc.of(Kind, ClassDesc, String, String).

name: java.lang.constant.DirectMethodHandleDesc
comment: A nominal descriptor for a direct MethodHandle. A DirectMethodHandleDesc corresponds to a Constant_MethodHandle_info entry in the constant pool of a classfile.

apiNote: In the future, if the Java language permits, DirectMethodHandleDesc may become a sealed interface, which would prohibit subclassing except by explicitly permitted types. Non-platform classes should not implement DirectMethodHandleDesc directly.
